intro: Hieracium tomiasiforme, commonly known as the Tomiasiforme hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, with hairy stems and alternate leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow, with ray florets surrounding a central disc of tubular flowers, and it blooms from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium tomiasiforme is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
